data.event: R.E. Darling named Mansfield in 1905 after his hometown of Mansfield, Ohio.
Mansfield's land was purchased and first developed in 1909 by the Great Northern Railway.
Mansfield was officially incorporated on February 23, 1911.
By 1914, the town had grown substantially, and had acquired two hotels, a bank, a doctor's office, and many more amenities.
In June 1914, a fire broke out in Mansfield's Knox Store, known as "Mansfield's greatest store".

event.title: November of the same year, fire destroyed

data.event: In November of the same year, fire destroyed the second block of Main Street.
